docs.lead_paragraph: CHO--Sihak Henry, 78, passed away on March 8, beloved husband of Myung Sook. He is the loving father of Kenneth K. and David P., and the grandfather of Jonathan, Lauren, Stephanie and Brittany. Korean Community leader and Martial Arts Pioneer - recipient of the 2011 Lifetime Achievement award by the President's Council on Sports, Fitness & Nutrition. Services will be held on Sunday, March 11, Monday, March 12 and the funeral on March 13. For more information, please visit: www.henrycho.com.

docs.lead_paragraph: So far, Meryl Davis and Charlie White, world champion ice dancers, have not been able to break through the public consciousness and get endorsements.

headline.seo: Meryl Davis and Charlie White Seek Olympic Gold in Russia in 2014. Will Endorsements Follow?
headline.main: Oh, to Bring ‘Gold’ Home, and Perhaps the Bacon
headline.print_headline: h, to Bring ‘Gold’ Home, And Perhaps the Bacon

docs.abstract: Meryl Davis and Charlie White, the only American ice dancing team to ever win the world championships, have their eyes set on winning the gold at the 2014 Olympic Games in Russia, but first must come up with a marketing strategy that will put the American public solidly behind them.
docs.snippet: So far, Meryl Davis and Charlie White, world champion ice dancers, have not been able to break through the public consciousness and get endorsements.

docs.lead_paragraph: Why use the poor chicken as a machine to produce meat when you can use a machine to produce “meat” that seems like chicken?
docs.abstract: Mark Bittman Op-Ed column submits that the question of whether to eat factory-farmed meat over meat substitutes gains more relevance as advances in food technology help to produce more palatable fake meats.
docs.snippet: Why use the poor chicken as a machine to produce meat when you can use a machine to produce “meat” that seems like chicken?

docs.lead_paragraph: In 1898, as history students learn, the battleship Maine blew up in Havana's harbor, but that was also the year the Bayer Company offered a new opiate cough medicine called Heroin, and the year the Kellogg brothers introduced cornflakes, which were so unpopular at first they grew stale on grocers' shelves. Thank James Trager for making these historical nuggets readily available to the reading public. They're part of his 1,206-page book ''The People's Chronology: A Year-by-Year Record of Human Events from Prehistory to the Present,'' published in 1979. For each year he discussed, he divided events into categories like literature, crime and everyday life.

headline.main: James Trager Is Dead at 86; Brought Facts to the Masses

docs.abstract: James Trager, encyclopedist and chronologist, dies at age 86. Photo (M)

docs.abstract: Shark cartilage, hyped as a cancer preventive and joint-health supplement, may contain a neurotoxin that has been linked with Alzheimer's and Lou Gehrig's disease, a new study suggests.
